greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n * sigma_0(n) + sigma_1(n).
comment: a(n) is the sum of all parts plus the total number of parts of all partitions of n into equal parts. - _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 30 2019
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} (k + 1) * x^k/(1 - x^k)^2. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 14 2019
example: For n = 4 the partitions of 4 into equal parts are [4], [2,2], [1,1,1,1]. The sum of all parts is 4 + 2 + 2 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 = 12. There are 7 parts, so a(4) = 12 + 7 = 19. - _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 30 2019
results.author: _Ctibor O. Zizka_, Nov 29 2008
